Class Yahtzee

  • java.lang.Object
    • Yahtzee

  • public class Yahtzee
extends java.lang.Object

    CSC421 Web-Based Design: Assignment #1

    Author: Christian Carreras
    Major: CSC Masters Software Development
    Creation Date: 09/12/2017
    Due Date: 09/22/2017
    School: Kutztown University of Pennsylvania
    Course: CSC 421 Web-Based Programming
    Professor Name: Dr. Dylan Schwesinger
    Assignment: #1
    Filename: a1.java
    Purpose: To partially implement a text-based version of the game of Yahtzee. This project
    will implement a one player version of the game that plays a single round of Yahtzee.

    Help

    Commands and project design decisions can be found in the readme.
    Categories for Yahtzee can be found here.
    Official rules to Yahtzee can be found here.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main method to the Yahtzee program. Starts the game normally or from the command-line.
        Parameters:
        args - String array of command-line arguments

      • checkClArgs

        public static boolean checkClArgs(java.lang.String[] args,
                                  int[] clDice)
        Checks command-line input for correct format. Correct format dictates that there must be 5 integers separated by a space. Integers must be in the range of one to six.
        Parameters:
        args - The list of command-line arguments if present
        clDice - Int array to return the command-line dice if applicable
        Returns:
        True if correct command-line format. False if not.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - Non-numeric data

      • playerPrompt

        public static void playerPrompt(int[] clDice,
                                boolean start,
                                int rnd)
        Handles all user input commands and links them to their corresponding fucntions. Prompt will continue until program termination (quit).
        Parameters:
        clDice - Command-line entered dice if applicable
        start - Used to signify whether to start the game initially
        rnd - Used to set the initial roll number

      • init

        public static boolean init(int[] dice,
                           java.util.List<int[]> rolls,
                           boolean[] kept)
        Sets all necessary data objects to their initial empty state and adds the current dice roll to the list of previous rolls.
        Parameters:
        dice - Integer array that holds the current roll
        rolls - A list of int arrays containing all previous rolls
        kept - Boolean array that that tells which dice are kept
        Returns:
        Always true to signify start of game

      • chkEndRnd

        public static boolean chkEndRnd(int[] dice,
                                java.util.List<int[]> rolls,
                                boolean[] kept,
                                boolean gPrg,
                                int rollNum)
        Checks if the game has reached the end of the round i.e. the number of rolls equals 3 or the user picked a category.
        Parameters:
        dice - Integer array that holds the current roll
        rolls - A list of int arrays containing all previous rolls
        kept - Boolean array that that tells which dice are kept
        gPrg - Boolean which states whether the game is currently in progress
        rollNum - How many rolls the user has currently rolled
        Returns:
        True if the game has reached the end of the round. False if not.

      • beginGame

        public static int[] beginGame(int[] d)
        Begins the game by printing the global stats compiled from the games before, rolling the dice and printing said dice to the screen. Checks if dice is set before rolling the dice.
        Parameters:
        d - Int array that will hold the first roll of the dice
        Returns:
        The freshly rolled dice if d was not set. Returns d if d is set.

      • prgErr

        public static boolean prgErr(boolean gPrg,
                             java.lang.String str)
        If the game is not in progress this will print an error message to screen.
        Parameters:
        gPrg - Boolean that tells if the game is in progress or not
        str - String to add to the "Game not in progress." error message
        Returns:
        gPrg: in order be able to place this function in an if statement

      • playerStats

        public static void playerStats(java.util.List<int[]> rolls,
                               int[] dice,
                               boolean[] kept,
                               int round)
        Shows the current statistics of the user's current round. Will show the number of rolls rolled, current dice rolled, current kept dice if applicable and all previous rolls including the current roll.
        Parameters:
        rolls - A list of int arrays containing all previous rolls
        dice - Integer array that holds the current roll
        kept - Boolean array that that tells which dice are kept
        round - the number of rolls rolled by the user

      • logStats

        public static void logStats(int[] dice,
                            java.lang.String category,
                            int roll)
        Logs the results of each round of the game to the log file. Information logged to the file include six integers: five corresponding to the current dice at round end and the last to represent how many rolls were rolled. The last bit of information is a String which stores what category the user picked at round end.
        Parameters:
        dice - Integer array that holds the current roll
        category - The category picked by the user
        roll - Number of rolls rolled by the user

      • printGlobStats

        public static void printGlobStats()
        Prints information from the log file to the screen. Information printed includes number of rounds played by any user and the average amount of rolls per round. Checks to see if the log file exists first. If the file does not exist tell the user they are first to play.

      • findGlobAvg

        public static float findGlobAvg()
        Finds the average number of rolls per round for each round logged into the data log file. Assumes the log file exists.
        Returns:
        The average rolls for each round played and logged

      • findGlobRounds

        public static int findGlobRounds()
        Finds the total number of rounds played by any user logged into the data log file. Assumes the log file exists.
        Returns:
        The total number of rounds played by any user

      • getFileBytes

        public static byte[] getFileBytes(java.io.File file)
        Get all the bytes contained within a file. If the file does not exist, print the stack trace and terminate the program.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to open and get the bytes from
        Returns:
        The byte array which contains all the bytes from the file

      • availCategor

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> availCategor(int[] dice)
        Compiles a list of categories available to user at the moment of this method call. Calls helper functions to separate the lower/upper sections.
        Parameters:
        dice - Integer array that holds the current roll
        Returns:
        List of Strings which holds all available categories
        See Also:
        catUpperSectHelper(int[], java.util.List<java.lang.String>), catLowerSectHelper(int[], java.util.List<java.lang.String>)

      • catUpperSectHelper

        public static void catUpperSectHelper(int[] dice,
                                      java.util.List<java.lang.String> catList)
        Adds to the list of categories by checking if the current dice fufill the prerequisites of each upper section categories. The upper section represents categories that only require a minimum of one dice of the matching number in order to be fulfilled. Helps availCategor.
        Parameters:
        dice - Integer array that holds the current roll
        catList - List of Strings to add categories to

      • catLowerSectHelper

        public static void catLowerSectHelper(int[] dice,
                                      java.util.List<java.lang.String> catList)
        Adds to the list of categories by checking if the current dice fufill the prerequisites of each lower section categories. The lower section represents categories that are special configurations of the dice including three dice the same, four dice the same, all five dice the same, three dice the same of one number and two the same of another, four sequential dice and five sequential dice. Helps availCategor.
        Parameters:
        dice - Integer array that holds the current roll
        catList - List of Strings to add categories to

      • pickCategory

        public static boolean pickCategory(int[] dice,
                                   int roll)
        Allows the user to pick a category from the currently available categories. Choosing a category will end the round and log the results of the round to the data file. Player may exit from making a choice by entering zero.
        Parameters:
        dice - Integer array that holds the current roll
        roll - Number of rolls rolled by the user
        Returns:
        True if a category was picked. False if one was not picked.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - User entered non-numeric input

      • countDice

        public static int countDice(int[] dice,
                            int num)
        Counts the number of dice that appear in the current roll that match the given parameter number.
        Parameters:
        dice - Integer array that holds the current roll
        num - The number to look for in the current roll
        Returns:
        The number of dice that exist in the roll with that number

      • addUnique

        public static void addUnique(java.util.List<java.lang.String> list,
                             java.lang.String str)
        Checks to see if there is an entry that matches the given String within the list already. If no such entry exists, add the String to the list.
        Parameters:
        list - List to add to and search for duplicate
        str - String to seach for within the list and add if it is unique

      • parseFile

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> parseFile(java.io.File file)
        Parses a file and splits it into token Strings by line. The strings are added to a list of Strings and returned once the whole file is parsed.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to parse
        Returns:
        The list that contains the String tokens

      • printList

        public static void printList(java.util.List<java.lang.String> list)
        Prints a given list of Strings. Used for printing parsed files.
        Parameters:
        list - List to print to screen (most likely parsed file)

      • printNumberedList

        public static void printNumberedList(java.util.List<java.lang.String> list)
        Prints a list of strings but numbers them according to their order in the list. Each entry is separated by a new-line.
        Parameters:
        list - List used to print a numbered list

      • printIntroTag

        public static void printIntroTag()
        Method to print a intro tag to welcome the user to the game and inform them of basic game information or anything else helpful.

      • nextRoll

        public static boolean nextRoll(int[] dice,
                               java.util.List<int[]> rolls,
                               boolean[] kept,
                               int rnd)
        Prints the roll to the screen and adds the roll to the previous rolls list.
        Parameters:
        dice - Integer array that holds the current roll
        rolls - List of previous rolls rolled by the user this round
        kept - Boolean list representing what dice the user is keeping
        rnd - The current roll the user is on this round
        Returns:
        Always false, signifies the user has not updated their kept dice

      • playerRoll

        public static boolean playerRoll(int[] dice,
                                 boolean[] kept,
                                 boolean pk)
        Method to roll the dice. First checks if the user has recently picked dice to keep from the previous rolls. If the user has not kept any dice a warning will be printed and the user will be asked to continue with the roll. If the user already picked dice to keep, the roll will continue without any warning.
        Parameters:
        dice - Integer array that holds the current roll
        kept - Boolean list representing what dice the user is keeping
        pk - Boolean to signify whether the user picked dice to keep or not
        Returns:
        True if the user successfully rolled. False if not.

      • swapDice

        public static void swapDice(int[] dice,
                            boolean[] kept)
        Rolls the dice and places the dice in a temporary holder. Then the actual dice object swaps out dice values that were not kept by the user.
        Parameters:
        dice - Integer array that holds the current roll
        kept - Boolean list representing what dice the user is keeping

      • addRoll

        public static void addRoll(int[] dice,
                           java.util.List<int[]> rolls)
        Adds a new roll to the list of previous rolls. This method is necessary because lists in java need to add new values. Adding old values already in the list modifies each one of the values to the newly added value.
        Parameters:
        dice - Integer array that holds the current roll
        rolls - List of previous rolls rolled by the user this round

      • rollDice

        public static int[] rollDice()
        Makes a roll of pseudo-random dice and returns that dice array
        Returns:
        The newly created (rolled) dice array

      • keepDice

        public static boolean[] keepDice(int[] dice)
        Method that allows the user decide what dice they would like to keep. The user will be asked for each dice if they want to keep it or not. After successfully deciding what dice to keep, the kept dice will be printed.
        Parameters:
        dice - Integer array that holds the current roll
        Returns:
        Boolean array containing which dice are kept and which are not

      • yesNoPrompt

        public static boolean yesNoPrompt(java.lang.String str)
        Prompts the user with a yes or no question. Changes the input to lower case for maximum compatibility.
        Parameters:
        str - String for the prompt to print (Should be a yes/no question)
        Returns:
        true if the user entered y (yes). False if the user entered n (no).

      • printKeptDice

        public static void printKeptDice(int[] dice,
                                 boolean[] keptDice)
        Prints the dice the user has decided to keep to the screen.
        Parameters:
        dice - Integer array that holds the current roll
        keptDice - Boolean list representing what dice the user is keeping

      • printDice

        public static java.lang.String printDice(int[] dice)
        Print each dice number separated by a space.
        Parameters:
        dice - Integer array that holds the current roll
        Returns:
        The String that contains the five dice ints separated by a space

      • translateToImage

        public static java.lang.String translateToImage(int[] dice)
        Creates a visible image to the likeness of a dice face. Each dice face will correspond to each number in the roll. Calls a helper function to figure what section of the dice face to print according to what level of the print the method is on. Dice faces are printed horizontally.
        Parameters:
        dice - Integer array that holds the current roll
        Returns:
        The string containing the dice face images
        See Also:
        imagerHelper(int, int)

      • imagerHelper

        public static int imagerHelper(int num,
                               int pos)
        Helps the translateToImage method by returning a key to get the correct portion of the dice face to print according to the number given and the section number.
        Parameters:
        num - The dice number
        pos - The section position number
        Returns:
        The key which is used to access the correct String in a String map
